src:
Recepti: Sladko jesensko razvajanje
Elena Klanjscek, ki živi v vasici Oslavje, v družinski gostinsko-turistični zgodbi skrbi za izvrstne slaščice, narejene po družinskih receptih.
05 Nov 2019, 16:11 by Š. A.



Elena, Petra in Dejan Klanjscek



Oslavje FOTOGRAFIJE: Špela Ankele



(K RECEPTU ZA JABOLČNI KOLAČ)



(K RECEPTU ZA POMARANČNI KOLAČ)


Tik čez slovensko-italijansko mejo, in to le nekaj kilometrov nad Gorico, je vasica Oslavje. V njej živi le 300 prebivalcev – velika večina je Slovencev.
Oštarijo vodila že nona
Vasica je daleč naokoli znana po rebuli, predvsem macerirani, torej oranžni, saj so tu doma številna, tudi svetovno znana vinogradniška imena, denimo Joško Gravner, Radikon, Dario Prinčič, Primosic, La Castellada, Il Carpino in Fiegl.In to je tista vasica, v kateri ima družina Klanjscek zadnjih nekaj mesecev odprto družinsko restavracijo, dopolnjeno s prenočišči. Kot nam je povedal Dejan Klanjscek, je bila tod v preteklosti že oštarija, ki jo je vodila njegova nona.Zdaj je glavni kuhar, pri pripravi jedi pa mu pomagata oče in stric. In medtem ko moški del družine poskrbi za glavno jed, nareže pršut in sir, so sladice v rokah Dejanove žene Elene.Jabolčni kolačZa 8–10 kosov:200 g moke150 g sladkorja130 g zmehčanega masla (na sobni temperaturi)3 jajca1 pecilni prašekščepec soli2 ali 3 jabolkaPečico ogrejemo na 180 stopinj Celzija. Jabolka olupimo in narežemo na rezine. Preostale sestavine zmešamo skupaj in jih vlijemo v namaščen ter rahlo pomokan pekač. Povrhu lepo razporedimo jabolčne rezine. Pečemo kakih 40 minut. Kolač lahko postrežemo še mlačen ali pa ga popolnoma ohladimo in posujemo s sladkorjem v prahu. Prava jesenska poezija!


(K RECEPTU ZA JABOLČNI KOLAČ)

Zakaj pa ne: kolač za zajtrk
Ker sta nas na jesensko jutro, in to že za zajtrk, dve Elenini sladici kar malo začarali, smo jo takoj poprosili za recepta. Narekovala je tega za jabolčni kolač in povedala navodila še za pripravo drugega, ki zadiši po pomarančah. »Pomarančni kolač spečem po receptu, ki mi ga je dala mama,« o preverjenem receptu pove Elena Klanjscek.Oba kolača sta odlična za dni, ko se ti že od jutra pred očmi prikazuje kakšna domača sladica, a za pripravo pite ali zavitka, ki takole jeseni kraljujeta med sladicami, morda ni dovolj časa, potrpežljivosti oziroma sestavin. Oba recepta sta preprosta za pripravo, hkrati pa sta obe sladici zelo, ampak res zelo okusni! 


(K RECEPTU ZA POMARANČNI KOLAČ)

Kolač s pomarančoZa 8–10 kosov:1 ekološka pomaranča3 jajca300 g sladkorja300 g mehke moke100 g olja100 g mleka1 pecilni prašekPečico segrejemo na 170 ali 180 stopinj Celzija. Izberemo ekološko pridelano pomarančo, jo operemo. V posodo naribamo lupinico, potem pa prerežemo in ožamemo. Pomarančni sok dodamo lupinici, nato pa odmerimo še vse druge sestavine. Dobro premešamo in pazimo, da v zmesi ni grudic. Zmes vlijemo v namaščen in narahlo pomokan pekač. Pečemo kakih 50 minut oziroma toliko časa, da se kolač lepo rjavkasto obarva. Ohladimo in postrežemo.
text:
Recipes: Sweet autumn pampering
Elena Klanjscek, who lives in the village of Oslavje, takes care of excellent pastries made in the family's hospitality and tourism story.
05 Nov 2019, 15:11 by Š. А.



Elena, Petra and Dejan Klanjscek



Photo Title: Cave of Ankela



(TO THE APPLE RECIPE)



(TO THE ORANGE CAKE RECIPE)


Just across the Slovenian-Italian border, just a few kilometers above Gorizia, is the village of Oslavje. It has only 300 inhabitants - the vast majority are Slovenes.
They are sharpening the guides already
The village is well known for its rebula, especially macerated, ie orange, as it houses many, including world-known vineyard names, such as Josko Gravner, Radikon, Dario Princic, Primosic, La Castellada, Il Carpino and Fiegl.And this is that village , in which the Klanjscek family has a family-owned restaurant open for the past few months, complete with accommodations. As Dejan Klanjscek told us, there was a sharpness in his past, led by his moneys. And while the male part of the family arranges the main course, slices of prosciutto and cheese, desserts are in the hands of Dejan's wife, Elena. Apple CakeFor 8-10 pieces: 200 g flour150 g sugar130 g softened butter (at room temperature) 3 eggs1 baking powder2 or 3 apples Preheat oven to 180 degrees Fahrenheit. Peel the apples and cut them into slices. Mix the remaining ingredients together and pour into a greased and slightly soaked baking pan. Apply apple slices nicely on top. Bake for about 40 minutes. The cake can be served lukewarm or completely cooled and sprinkled with powdered sugar. Real autumn poetry!


(TO THE APPLE RECIPE)

Why not: a breakfast muffin
Since two of Elena's desserts enchanted us quite a bit on Autumn morning for breakfast, we immediately asked her for recipes. She dictated this to an apple pie and gave instructions for preparing another to smell the oranges. "I bake an orange muffin according to a recipe my mom gave me," Elena Klanjscek tells of the recipe. this is how dessert reigns in the autumn, there may not be enough time, patience or ingredients. Both recipes are easy to prepare, but at the same time, both desserts are very, but really delicious!


(TO THE ORANGE CAKE RECIPE)

Orange cakeFor 8-10 pieces: 1 organic orange3 eggs300g sugar300g soft flour100g oil100g milk1 baking powderBake oven to 170 or 180 degrees Celsius. We choose organically grown orange, wash it. Peel the shell into the pan, then cut and squeeze. Orange juice is added to the peel and then all other ingredients are weighed. Mix well and make sure there are no lumps in the mixture. Pour the mixture into a greased and lightly soaked baking pan. Bake for about 50 minutes or until the cake is nicely brownish. Cool and serve.
